Funny cosplay Costumes -Tickle Your Funny Bone

Every day is a good day for humor. Funny character costumes, hilarious food costumes, funny cute animal or insect costumes or clever costumes make us giggle. A funny costume may keep you laughing all year long. See some great humorous cosplay costumes, which are also great choices for this Halloween.


It’s a beer girl hero costume. The short, shiny blue polyester dress ties around the neck and comes with a three strap beer holster on either side of the waist. Bottle caps and a red foam Velcro belt are also attached to the dress. A shiny yellow cape and red foam leg cuffs finish this costume. Become the ever-celebrated bringer of beer in a funny adult Beer Girl Hero costume and team up with Beer Man for a fantastic superhero couples costume!


Rule the streets as a fearless mobster in this adult massive gangster costume! The funny 1920s costume includes an over-sized, detailed mask that is textured to make it appear wrinkled. The coat’s classic look comes from a combination of the broad collar and the four buttons in the front. An inflatable shoulder-piece makes for a very muscular appearance in the chest and shoulders. Add our toy tommy guns or any of our gangster accessories and show them.



Promote healthy treats this Halloween in our green adult grapes costume! The fruity costume includes a green tunic. The tunic has long sleeves and an attached dark green leaf at the top. The entire tunic is covered in round pocket-like pieces of fabric. Slip on our cartoon hands and join up with our fruit costumes for a funny group costume idea!


Now your whole family can join in the fun this Halloween with our infant tux penguin costume! The black and white jumpsuit is soft to the touch. The sleeves flare out to resemble wings and a red bow tie is attached at the top. A pair of penguin feet booties are also included and have grips on the bottom. The penguin hood has a plush beak on top and snaps behind the neck to secure it in place. A plush top hat completes the look of this handsome tuxedo penguin.

You can find many Halloween costumesat www.mltailor.com. There are many discounted products.

How to Buy a Plus Size Wedding Dress

Your Big day is confirmed, Next to choose wedding dresses and accessories. Having a full figure doesn’t mean you can’t have the wedding dress of your dreams. In today’s bridal market, you can find a plus size wedding dresswith all the features of a misses’ size. Enjoy your big day even more when you are wearing a dress in which you feel beautiful and confident.

Instructions
•Take accurate measurements before you head out to the bridal shop to look for a plus size wedding dress. You can supply the sales clerk with this information, which may help identify those dresses which can be made in larger sizes to fit your bust, waist and hip measurements.
•Wear the kind of supportive undergarments you might wear on the day of your wedding when you shop for plus size wedding gowns. You should also wear them for all of your fittings to ensure accurate alterations in the dress you buy.
•Shop for a dress that will de-emphasize your problem areas while bring attention to your best features. This will involve becoming familiar with the variety of silhouettes available in the bridal gown market.
•Seek out slim A-line dresses if you have a pear-shaped figure. These draw attention to your bust and shoulders while minimizing the appearance of your waist and hips.
•Find a princess-cut dress if you want to show off your longer torso and slimmer waist. These dresses have the bodice and skirt cut in one, providing the body with a slimming, long line from shoulder to just below the waist, where the skirt can be cut into an A-line, hiding wider hips and rear.
•Shop for a cover-up to wear with your strapless or tank-style gown. Since strapless bridal gowns continue to be popular in bridal fashion, you can use this option to cover up problem areas in your arms and shoulders without having to have a sleeved gown custom-made.
•Buy a dress with a heavier-weight fabric. Since bias-cut and knit fabrics tend to cling to every curve, they should be avoided in favor of heavy-weight fabrics which help shape your body.
•Buy your dress at least 6 months in advance of your wedding date to allow plenty of time for construction and delivery. Most plus size dresses can’t be bought straight off the rack.
Tips & Warnings
Avoid satin and other shiny fabrics, which reflect light and make you look larger. Opt for lace or other textured fabrics.
Keep in mind that most sample wedding dresses come in the equivalent of a size 6 in sportswear. Phone the bridal shop in advance to ask for larger sizes to be made available for your appointment.

Figure Shaping Plus Size Wedding Dress
Won’t worry yourwedding dresses for plus size, customize a perfect wedding dresses at http://www.mltailor.com, meet all your requests.

Are you all about color and style(2)

Fashion designers have created gorgeous colorful fashion collections for the 2010 spring summer season which enchant the eyes. Neon and warm tone colors like aqua blue, turquoise, pink, yellow, green, orange were among the most popular colors used. Inspire yourself from gorgeous and colorful fashion collections featuring different fashion styles for 2010 like Baby Phat by Kimora Lee Simmons, Blumarine, Versace, Basso & Brooke, Alexander McQueen and many more.

Colorful printed outfits look incredibly hot but they are hard to combine. If you are going for an overall colorful printed pants or skirt don’t choose a printed pattern on the upper part as well. You might over do it and create an unpleasant looking outfit. If you are not sure about your outfit it is best to go for less that too much, as you know sometimes less is more!

How to Cook-up Some Scary Halloween Food

Wanna held a party on halloween? Is your Halloween party all that until somebody asks for food, and well, you didn’t have anything ready? With these easy recipes you can have your drinks, appetizers, dinner and dessert!
Instructions
Make your drink, “Chopped hands in slime”:
Take your fruit-punch and pour it into the cauldron.Make sure your punch is a weird color. Next, wash the latex glove(s) and fill it with water,add a bit of food coloring if you like. Then stick them into the freezer. When the time is right take the ice “hands”, and put it into the punch(remember to take the glove off).
Brain Pate:
Buy a lot of your favorite pate(or spread). Arrange on a plate in a big heaping ball. Carve some brainy shapes onto the pate. Put some bread and crackers onto the plate for a delicious appetizer.
Time for some fruits and veggies:
Little treats:
The main course:
The most important part of the meal is your main course. Cook your potatoes, chicken, rice,etc. and then place it in the tinfoil, which should then be arranged in the skeleton. You may have to cut the top of the ribs off for easy access to the food.
Tips & Warnings
1, Arrange the food as scarily as possible

2, Make sure to check on the guests allergies before they eat

Besides, Prepare some [url=]Scary Halloween costumes[/url]for your kids or friends can add spices to your party. Get more suggestions, please visit http://www.mltailor.com, Help you enjoy the coming halloween 2011.

Michelle Williams in green chiffon gown


Michelle Williams – Hot Off the Spring 2012 Runway
Paris Fashion Week just finished last week, but next season’s gowns are already hitting the red carpet. If you were curious as to how the bevy of sheer, boudoir-inspired gowns would translate from the runway, look to Michelle Williams for a lovely, slightly more modest take. For the New York premiere of her upcoming Marilyn Monroe biopic My Week With Marilyn, Michelle chose the seafoam green chiffon gown from Dior’s Spring ’12 collection. She added a slip, the belt from the show, and a cocktail ring. Michelle kept her makeup minimal, going for dewy skin. We love the fresh, glowing, elegant look.

Celebs Dressed to The Nines at L’Oreal Paris Legends Gala


Last night, many celebs and New Yorkers attended the L’Oreal Paris Legends Gala to benefit the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund (OCRF). In the picture below, Kerry Washington, Taraji P. Henson and Michael Michele (Gossip Girl) came together and dressed to the nines. Let’s have a look at their celebrity dresses!
The belles of the ball each took a different approach to evening glamour to arrive at the dinner program held at the American Museum of Natural History. Kerry Washington joined the ranks of her fellow L’Oreal spokeswomen Juliana Margulies (the evening’s host) and Andie MacDowell, and shined in a stunning long-sleeved Ralph Lauren evening gown. The warm, bronzy creation really complemented her skin tone and she played up the overall glow with Lorraine Schwartz and Ralph Lauren necklaces, a smoky eye and soft waves.
Meanwhile, Taraji and Michael both stood out in bright blue. Michael’s off-the shoulder Alberta Ferretti gown featured a playful bow detailing in the back and she matched the dress with jewel drop earrings. Taraji went for a sexy mid-calf Herve Leroux dress paired with strappy Jimmy Choo heels.
The most fab detail of the evening: the fete—which included a silent auction produced by Harper’s Bazaar, Marie Claire, Town & Country and Veranda magazines. The night raised $2.1 million dollars for the cause. Over the last 14 years, L’Oreal Paris has helped raise more than $19 million for OCRF.
For more celebrity dresses, please visit http://www.mltailor.com/

Bandage Dress Fan – Jennifer Love Hewitt

Undoubtedly, Jennifer Love Hewitt is a bandage dress fan. Jennifer Love Hewitt has taken it to the extreme with her love of the bandage dress. Now, let’s look at her celebrity dresses.

The 32-year-old unveiled her latest acquisition outside her Toluca Lake home on November 3rd (evening); a black bandage dress clothing with a front gold zip.

The actress was heading to the premiere of Leonardo DiCaprio’s new film J. Edgar and brought some glamour to her quiet suburban neighborhood.
Showing off her fantastic curves Jennifer jumped into her limousine and arrived shortly afterwards at Grauman’s Chinese Theatre in Hollywood, California.
[url="http://blog.mltailor.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/20111105a3.png";][/url]
Last week she wore a similar dress to the premiere of Like Crazy and teamed the navy blue outfit with a pair of grey Louboutins.

The pint-sized star is suited to these dresses as her weight often fluctuates. Last year she was noticeably thinner when she opted for a sky blue bandage dress.
She now appears to have a bigger bust and a more soft and voluptuous figure, in contrast to the trim shape she previously favored.

Jennifer pictured in a white bandage dress earlier this year and at the Ghost Whisperer 100 Episode party in 2010 when she was slightly thinner
Most women have a go-to item in their wardrobe that they know they can look good in every time.
What’s your go-to item?

A Glinting Warm Winter Wedding Idea (1)

Choose some glinting silvery white wedding dress, and shed the warmth on the coldest winter days. From effortless chic wedding gown to resplendent ivory silk gloves, crystal hair accessories to ivory shoes, it’s a great winter wedding that makes people forget the chill weather.

Choose an effortless chic gown. This fashion-forward goddess look dress is draped and ruched into a universally flattering fit-and-flare column wedding dress. The sheer straps look awesome which can wore as cap sleeves.


A cover-up is a chic addition, and then consider the fashion-forward collar. Densely woven tufts of soft wool settle upon your shoulders, while queenly scallops of blush pearls are around your neck. Pearl loop closure looks like the necklace.

A pair of bow-length gloves can keep warm. The bow embellishment add femininity look. The shimmering stretch silk adds charm.
www.mltailor.com, online tailor can make your dream dress come true.

3 Best Dressed Celebs at the Britannia Awards 2011

Walking the 2011 Britannia Awards red carpet at the Beverly Hilton Hotel, there was fashion to see as Felicity Jones, Helen Mirren and Helena Bonham Carter looked amazing for the evening. The event was to honor the best British actors in the entertainment world in 2011. There was plenty of star power attending the event. Let’s have a look at 3 best dressed celebrity dresses.
Sharing the delight of the evening, the ladies looked fabulous. Felicity Jones wore a strapless black evening gown that hugged her figure. True Hollywood classic fashion, the entertainer looked stunning for the event. Not to be outdone, Helen Mirren also looked gorgeous. The actress had a dusty rose tea gown that shimmered as she walked across the red carpet. Giving the glamour a boost, the entertainer was exquisite in her gown.

Helena Bonham Carter, who won The Britannia award for British Artist of the Year, was the other entertainer who was stunning on the red carpet but she had more of a reckless look. With a deep red dress, the entertainer had a black coat with a black vest. Her hair a bit disheveled, the star seemed comfortable with her gown.

She looked stylish, opting for a new season Zara printed dress with a black Ralph Lauren jacket. However, she added a touch of her characteristic conservative style with opaque black tights and matching heels.

What Do Middle Eastern Brides Really Want

When it comes to the wedding dresses and jewelry, what do Middle Eastern brides really want? The Bride Show has some unexpected answers to that question! The annual wedding event, comprising The Bride Show Abu Dhabi and The Bride Show Dubai, has just revealed the results of its survey. Let’s sneak a peek at the findings!
The survey, which included over 700 ladies, discovered that brides in the region clearly prefer classic fashion to celebrity fads. Think Kate Middleton over Kim Kardashian!

Out of the total number of women who participated, just under half said that they preferred a traditional wedding look, like the Sarah Burton for Alexander McQueen dress worn by the Duchess of Cambridge at her wedding to Prince William in April 2011.
The actual demand for Kate-style wedding gowns was high in the region too. Joumana Al Hayek, Owner and Head Designer at Dar Sara revealed, “The British royal wedding had a huge impact on our clients’ tastes. Over the past few months we’ve been asked to copy Catherine’s dress, or to design something equally as elegant. It is interesting to me that her dress was quite close to the Arabic tradition, which favors a covered, graceful and luxurious style.”

Scoring much lower on the wedding dress popularity charts in the survey was Kim Kardashian. Less than a third of the survey respondents said that they wanted to copy the style of a celeb like the reality TV star, whose marriage to Kris Humphries lasted just 72 days. Kim had three wedding dresses, all designed by Vera Wang, when she married Kris in August 2011.
Elaborate couture was the next leading pick in the survey, with 27 per cent of brides choosing it for themselves. Bohemian style did the worst, with just about 4 per cent of the women surveyed choosing it.
And as a bride-to-be, what kind of wedding dress do you want?
For more bridal gowns, please visit http://www.mltailor.com/.

Rachel Bilson Lends Her Expert Eye for Piperlime Again

Rachel Bilson premieres New Picks for Piperline. With her uncanny ability to add some casual cool to even the most classic silhouettes, Rachel Bilson once again lends her expert eye as a guest editor for Piperlime. Let’s check out her celebrity dress now!

Her picks include sensible Rachel Comey booties, a pleated Vince maxi skirt (reminiscent of this bohemian look by Rachel Bruno) and a splendid striped henley, now on sale for $55. “I love stripes and I love cozy,” she declares. ‘Nuff said!

The Hart of Dixie star, who also shills for Sunglass Hut, curates a new selection of affordable to aspirational items to reflect her trademark “comfy” style. “I like to say I’m a moody dresser,” she explains. “I wake up and then I kind of dress according to how I’m feeling.”

Do you like stripes and cozy? If so, you can also draw inspiration from Rachel Bilson’s dress.

For more celebrity dresses, please visit http://www.mltailor.com/

Wear a Blazer over Your Maxi Dress

It’s cold outside. Putting on a blazer over your maxi evening dress is a good way to keep warm. Let’s get inspired from celebrity style.

Charlize Theron visited “The Tonight Show with Jay Leno” to promote her latest movie, ‘Young Adult’, earlier this week. She wore a Christian Dior Resort 2012 maxi dress. Her polka-dot long-sleeve dress, with a necktie and pendant dangling from the waist tie, was worn with a black Stella McCartney blazer to prevent the look from feeling too casual.
Charlize styled her wavy locks into a chic updo and accessorized with Melinda Maria bangles and gold-hooped earrings. Snakeskin crisscross Reed Krakoff ‘Boxer’ sandals completed her look. Gals, take Charlize Theron’s lead. It looked great.

For more special occasion dresses, please visit www.mltailor.com.

Britney Spears who is Planning Her Third Wedding Now

As fans of Britney Spears, we are glad to hear the good news that Britney Spears is planning her third wedding now. Yes, Britney Spears and Jason Trawick just got engaged. And we are wondering about the wedding. What type of wedding dress will she wear? Where in the world will she tie the knot? Who will be invited?

Longtime boyfriend and former agent Jason Trawick reportedly proposed to the singer on Thursday night, while the couple was celebrating his 40th birthday.
A source tells US Weekly magazine, “This is something they’ve both wanted for a long time.”
Trawick and Spears are planning to celebrate the big news with family and friends on Friday night (16Dec11) at Planet Hollywood in Las Vegas, according to the publication.
And Spears appears to have confirmed the news in a Friday morning tweet, writing: “OMG. Last night Jason surprised me with the one gift I’ve been waiting for. Can’t wait to show you! SO SO SO excited!!!!”
The couple met in 2006 when Trawick began representing Spears while she was still married to Kevin Federline. They became an item in 2009.
Spears has been married twice before – to Jason Alexander and Federline. Her marriage to Alexander lasted just 55 hours and she divorced Federline in 2007.
We all wish the couple could live happy ever after. And we can’t wait to witness her third wedding…
For more wedding dresses, please visit http://www.mltailor.com/

Steal Kylie Minogue's style

Last night was supposed to be all about the comedians. However, Kylie Minogue stole the British Comedy Awards last night in a show-stopping evening dress, slashed to the thigh, revealing her toned legs. Let’s check out her celebrity dress!

The stunning two-toned number featured a red corset-like top half with a black piece draped over one shoulder and finishing past her ankles.
She’s definitely still got it! Kylie Minogue showed off a lot of leg in this gorgeous two-toned dress at the British Comedy Awards.
The Australian singer paired the evening gown with strappy black heels and had her strawberry blonde hair in loose curls.

Flanked by Jonathan Ross, the 43-year-old presented the British Comedy Academy Outstanding Achievement Award during the two-hour ceremony.
The gong went to E4?s The Inbetweeners.

Kylie presented the award to the Inbetweeners cast and posed with the show’s main men back stage – Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, Blake Harrison and James Buckley.
Do you like her dress?
